items.title: *.daily IG accounts.
items.content_html:

items.title: A Belated Happy Global Running Day üåé
items.content_html:
34% of my goal complete for running new miles in 2024

I spent Global Running Day running on a tread and then doing a 3 mile shakeout with the OTF run club.

Running has made me addicted to progress.

Keep going. üí™

items.title: Striking a Balance: Simplifying Choices for Better DevEx
items.content_html:
Software is fleeting and continuously changing so making decisions about tools can be quite the challenge. Ultimately, engineers will tend to have a lot of opinions. This week, my colleague dropped a truth-bomb:

“We always underestimate the maintenance required for variations.”

There was a recent work discussion on node test frameworks. We debated the merits of options like the native Node runner, Jest, and Vitest, realizing that too many choices can overwhelm rather than empower developers.

So, how do we strike a balance? Simplify. Whether it’s through a tech radar or a playbook, recommending the most widely used tool or the latest “hotness” streamlines decision-making without drowning developers in options. Because in the end, being prescriptive isn’t about stifling creativity ‚Äì it’s about guiding developers through the maze with clarity.
items.content_text:

So, how do we strike a balance? Simplify. Because in the end, being prescriptive isn't about stifling creativity ‚Äì it's about guiding developers through the maze with clarity.

items.title: Goal: 200 New Miles in 2024?
items.content_html:
Late in 2023, I found a cool app called wandrer.earth that motivates you to explore unfamiliar places and veer off from your typical routes. It effectively tracks new miles traveled and integrates seamlessly with Strava, where I record my runs. After integrating it with Strava, it automatically runs a backfill of your recorded runs to tally the total unique miles. As of the date of this blog post, I have achieved the following:

  • Covered 503.9 new miles running
  • Ran in 4 countries: United States, Canada, Dominican Republic, and the Philippines
  • Ran in 21 different provinces/states

In 2024, I’ve committed to run a new route whenever I travel and so far I’ve ran 54.99 new miles.

My goal is to his 200 unique miles by the end of 2024 (+263%). Sounds…reasonable?
items.content_text: Late in 2023, I found a cool app called [wandrer.earth](https://wandrer.earth/) that motivates you to explore unfamiliar places and veer off from your typical routes. It effectively tracks *new miles* traveled and integrates seamlessly with [Strava](https://www.strava.com/athletes/21756504), where I record my runs. After integrating it with Strava, it automatically runs a backfill of your recorded runs to tally the total unique miles. As of the date of this blog post, I have achieved the following: * Covered *503.9* new miles running * Ran in *4* countries: United States, Canada, Dominican Republic, and the Philippines * Ran in *21* different provinces/states In 2024, I've committed to run a new route whenever I travel and so far I've ran 54.99 new miles. My goal is to his 200 unique miles by the end of 2024 (+263%). Sounds...reasonable?

items.title: obsidian
items.content_html: I was recently introduced to obsidian.md for note taking and it’s slick. Favorite feature so far is the daily note.
